channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Knife crime: Cardiff stabbings prompt government help call from MP
item.description: Three men are in hospital after two unrelated stabbing incidents in Cardiff over the weekend.

item.title: Shotton: Man in court over murder of ex-wife Jade Ward
item.description: Russell Marsh, 29, is accused of killing mother-of-four Jade Ward at his home.

item.title: Gower gig paused to request lifeboat crew after woman stung by fish
item.description: Frontman Jon Tarrant told the crowd: "You're about to see a real-life lifeboat shout in action."

item.title: Hospitality: Bullying, low pay and burn-out blamed for staff shortage
item.description: As another popular Welsh restaurant closes its doors, what's next for the hospitality industry?

item.title: Illegal Brecon Beacons rave broken up by police
item.description: Drugs and vehicles are seized after revellers from as far as Essex and London join Powys rave.

item.title: Covid: Classrooms to get £6m anti-Covid air technology
item.description: Schools, colleges and universities in Wales are promised air monitors and ozone disinfecting machines.

item.title: Aaron Ramsey: Juventus midfielder one of four injury withdrawals from Wales squad
item.description: Juventus midfielder Aaron Ramsey, Joe Rodon, Neco Williams and George Thomas withdraw from the Wales squad against Finland, Belarus and Estonia.

item.title: Porthmadog: Drivers told to stop ignoring level crossing lights
item.description: Motorists in a coastal town are driving through flashing lights alerting them to oncoming trains.

item.title: Give UK workers four more bank holidays a year, says TUC
item.description: The trades union body says having just eight public holidays in England and Wales is "stingy" .

item.title: Flood prevention: Swansea University study reveals role of wetlands
item.description: Vegetation can save up to £27m in avoided damage per estuary during a large storm, researchers say.

item.title: Connor Roberts: Burnley eye Swansea City's Wales defender
item.description: Burnley could move for Swansea City's Wales defender Connor Roberts ahead of Tuesday's transfer deadline.

item.title: Covid cases reach highest level in Wales since January
item.description: Despite rising cases, the number of people dying from Covid remains low according to figures.

item.title: Stormzy, Skepta and Aitch: Making beats for rap stars at 19
item.description: Chris Rich has made thousands from creating beats in the style of hip hop's elite.

item.title: Payday lenders: 'They are robbing the vulnerable'
item.description: Within months of his first £150 payday loan, Tom owed £6,000 to 10 lenders.

item.title: Snowdon: Amputee crawls up mountain to raise funds for children
item.description: It will be the first time Paul Ellis has made his way up a mountain after losing his legs in 2008.

item.title: North Wales tourism has strained communities, authority says
item.description: Snowdonia National Park Authority said numbers visiting brought benefits and challenges.

item.title: Scrapping theory tests could cut HGV driver shortage, says instructor
item.description: One lorry driving instructor said it can take up to 16 months to train up new drivers.

item.title: Covid: Stay outside for the bank holiday, minister urges
item.description: Health Minister Eluned Morgan said, amid rising case rates, people need to take precautions

item.title: Daniel James: Leeds close to signing Manchester United and Wales winger for club record £30m
item.description: Leeds United are closing in on a club record £30m deal to sign Manchester United winger Dan James.

item.title: Wrexham 1-1 Notts County: Paul Mullin rescues Dragons against Magpies
item.description: Paul Mullin's header deservedly earns a point for Wrexham after Kyle Wootton had given visiting Notts County the lead.

item.title: Angharad James and Amy Turner relishing competing for NWSL title
item.description: Angharad James and Amy Turner are relishing the challenge of competing against each other for the National Women's Super League title.

item.title: Wayne Routledge: Veteran forward says Swansea City playing career is over
item.description: Veteran forward Wayne Routledge announces that his time as a Swansea City player is over.

item.title: County Championship: Shane Snater puts Essex on top against Glamorgan
item.description: Essex seamer Shane Snater claims six wickets as Glamorgan are bowled out for 134 with Essex reaching 92-2 in reply.

item.title: Galw am weithredu yn dilyn sawl achos o drywanu
item.description: Daw ar ôl i dri pherson gael eu hanafu mewn achosion yn ymwneud â chyllyll o fewn 24 awr yn y brifddinas.

item.title: 'Dyw'r feirws ddim yn jôc i bobl ifanc'
item.description: Mae merch o Gasnewydd yn annog pobl ifanc i gael eu brechu ar ôl iddi orfod cael gofal dwys yn yr ysbyty.

item.title: Dyn yn y llys wedi ei gyhuddo o lofruddio'i gyn-wraig
item.description: Dyn 29 oed wedi ymddangos yn y llys wedi ei gyhuddo o lofruddio ei gyn-wraig yn Sir y Fflint.

item.title: Cofio'r ciws ar gopa'r Wyddfa... yn 1894
item.description: Yn ôl yr hanesydd Elin Tomos, mae Cymru yn denu ymwelwyr lu ers Oes Fictoria

item.title: Morgannwg ar ei hôl hi yn y bencampwriaeth
item.description: Cafodd Morgannwg eu bowlio allan am 134 o rediadau ar fore cyntaf gêm yn erbyn Essex.
